questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
A binary liquid solution is prepared by mixing n-heptane and ethanol. Which one of the following
statements is correct regarding the behaviour of the solution ?

option_texts.A: The solution formed is an ideal solution
option_texts.B: The solution is non-ideal, showing +ve deviation from Raoult’s law.
option_texts.C: The solution is non-ideal, showing –ve deviation from Raoult’s law.
option_texts.D: n-heptane shows +ve deviation while ethanol shows –ve deviation from Raoult’s law.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:

CH3 - CH = CH - CH(OH) - Me is :

questions.question_text: The alkene that exhibits geometrical isomerism is :

questions.question_text: The IUPAC name of neopentane is

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Arrange the carbanions, $${(C{H_3})_3}\overline C $$,  $$\overline C C{l_3}$$ , $${(C{H_3})_2}\overline C H$$, $${C_6}{H_5}\overline C H{}_2$$ in order of their decreasing stability :

option_texts.A: $${(C{H_3})_2}\overline C H$$ > $$\overline C C{l_3}$$ > $${C_6}{H_5}\overline C H{}_2$$ > $${(C{H_3})_3}\overline C $$
option_texts.B: $$\overline C C{l_3}$$ > $${C_6}{H_5}\overline C H{}_2$$ > $${(C{H_3})_2}\overline C H$$ > $${(C{H_3})_3}\overline C $$
option_texts.C: $${(C{H_3})_3}\overline C $$ > $${(C{H_3})_2}\overline C H$$ > $${C_6}{H_5}\overline C H{}_2$$ > $$\overline C C{l_3}$$
option_texts.D: $${C_6}{H_5}\overline C H{}_2$$ > $$\overline C C{l_3}$$ > $${(C{H_3})_3}\overline C $$ > $${(C{H_3})_2}\overline C H$$

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Solid Ba(NO3)2 is gradually dissolved in a 1.0 $$\times$$ 10-4 M Na2CO3 solution. At what concentration of Ba2+ will a precipitate begin to form ?

(Ksp for BaCO3 = 5.1 $$\times$$ 10−9 )

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
On the basis of the following thermochemical data : 
($$\Delta _fG^oH^+_{(aq)}$$ = 0)



H2O(l) $$\to$$ H+(aq) + OH-(aq); $$\Delta H$$ = 57.32 kJ

H2(g) + $${1 \over 2} O_2(g) \to$$ H2O(l); $$\Delta H$$ = -286.20 kJ


The value of enthalpy of formation of OH− ion at 25oC is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Two liquids X and Y form an ideal solution. At 300K, vapour pressure of the solution containing 1 mol
of X and 3 mol of Y is 550 mm Hg. At the same temperature, if 1 mol of Y is further added to this
solution, vapour pressure of the solution increases by 10 mm Hg. Vapour pressure (in mm Hg) of X
and Y in their pure states will be, respectively :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
In Cannizzaro reaction given below 

2PhCHO $$\buildrel {\mathop {:OH}\limits^{\left(  -  \right)} } \over
 \longrightarrow $$ PhCH2OH + $$PhC\mathop O\limits^{..} $$2(-)

 the slowest step is :

option_texts.A: the transfer of hydride to the carbonyl group
option_texts.B: the abstraction of proton from the carboxylic group
option_texts.C: the attack of $$:\mathop {OH}\limits^{( - )} $$ at the carboxyl group

fruity smell was formed. The liquid was :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Knowing that the Chemistry of lanthanoids (Ln) is dominated by its +3 oxidation state, which of the
following statements is incorrect?

option_texts.A:
Because of the large size of the Ln (III) ions the bonding in its compounds is predominantly ionic in
 character.
option_texts.B: The ionic sizes of Ln (III) decrease in general with increasing atomic number.
option_texts.D: Ln (III) hydroxides are mainly basic in character.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: In context with the transition elements, which of the following statements is incorrect ?

option_texts.A: In addition to the normal oxidation states, the zero oxidation state is also shown by these elements in complexes.
option_texts.B: In the highest oxidation states, the transition metal show basic character and form cationic complexes.
option_texts.C: In the highest oxidation states of the first five transition elements (Sc to Mn), all the 4s and 3d electrons are used for bonding
option_texts.D:
Once the d^{5} configuration is exceeded, the tendency to involve all the 3d electrons in bonding
 decreases.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:

completion of 99% of the chemical reaction will be (log 2=0.301) :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
In a fuel cell methanol is used as fuel and oxygen gas is used as an oxidizer. The reaction is

CH3OH(l) + 3/2O2  $$\to$$ CO2 (g) + 2H2O (l) 

At 298K standard Gibb’s energies of formation for CH3OH(l), H2O(l) and CO2 (g) are -166.2, -237.2 and -394.4 kJ mol−1 respectively. If standard enthalpy of combustion of methanol is -726 kJ mol−1, efficiency of the fuel cell will be

The value of standard electrode potential for the change, 

Fe3+ (aq) + e- $$\to$$ Fe2+ (aq) will be

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Using MO theory, predict which of the following species has the shortest bond length?

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: In which of the following arrangements, the sequence is not strictly according to the property written against it

option_texts.A: CO_{2} < SiO_{2} <  SnO_{2} < PbO_{2} : increasing oxidising power
option_texts.B: HF < HCl < HBr, HI : increasing acid strength
option_texts.C: NH_{3} < PH_{3} < AsH_{3} < SbH_{3} : increasing basic strength
option_texts.D: B < C < O < N : increasing first ionization enthalpy

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
In an atom, an electron is moving with a speed of 600 m/s with an accuracy of 0.005%. Certainity
with which the position of the electron can be located is (h = 6.6 $$\times$$ 10-34 kg m2s-1, mass of electron, em = 9.1 $$\times$$ 10-31 kg)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Calculate the wavelength (in nanometer) associated with a proton moving at 1.0 x 103 ms−1
 (Mass of proton = 1.67 $$\times$$ 10-27 kg and h =  6.63 $$\times$$ 10-34 Js) :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Statement - 1 : The variance of first n even natural numbers is $${{{n^2} - 1} \over 4}$$


Statement - 2 : The sum of first n natural numbers is $${{n\left( {n + 1} \right)} \over 2}$$ and the sum of squares of first n natural numbers is $${{n\left( {n + 1} \right)\left( {2n + 1} \right)} \over 6}$$

option_texts.A: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true; Statement-2 is a correct explanation for Statement-1
option_texts.B: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true; Statement-2 is not a correct explanation for Statement-1
option_texts.C: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is false
option_texts.D: Statement-1 is false, Statement-2 is true

questions.question_text:
If the mean deviation of number 1, 1 + d, 1 + 2d,........, 1 + 100d from their mean is 255, then the d is
equal to

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: For real x, let f(x) = x3 + 5x + 1, then

option_texts.A: f is one-one but not onto R
option_texts.B: f is onto R but not one-one
option_texts.C: f is one-one and onto R
option_texts.D: f is neither one-one nor onto R

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$f\left( x \right) = {\left( {x + 1} \right)^2} - 1,x \ge  - 1$$


Statement - 1 : The set $$\left\{ {x:f\left( x \right) = {f^{ - 1}}\left( x \right)} \right\} = \left\{ {0, - 1} \right\}$$.


Statement - 2 : $$f$$ is a bijection.

option_texts.A: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true; Statement - 2 is a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.B: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true; Statement - 2 is not a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.C: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is false
option_texts.D: Statement - 1 is false, Statement - 2 is true

questions.subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Given $$P\left( x \right) = {x^4} + a{x^3} + b{x^2} + cx + d$$ such that $$x=0$$ is the only 

real root of $$P'\,\left( x \right) = 0.$$ If $$P\left( { - 1} \right) < P\left( 1 \right),$$ then in the interval $$\left[ { - 1,1} \right]:$$

option_texts.A: $$P(-1)$$ is not minimum but $$P(1)$$ is the maximum of $$P$$
option_texts.B: $$P(-1)$$ is the minimum but $$P(1)$$ is not the maximum of $$P$$
option_texts.C: Neither $$P(-1)$$ is the minimum nor $$P(1)$$ is the maximum of $$P$$
option_texts.D: $$P(-1)$$ is the minimum and $$P(1)$$ is the maximum of $$P$$

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$f\left( x \right) = x\left| x \right|$$ and $$g\left( x \right) = \sin x.$$

Statement-1: gof is differentiable at $$x=0$$ and its derivative is continuous at that point. 

Statement-2: gof is twice differentiable at $$x=0$$.

option_texts.A: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true; Statement-2 is not a correct explanation for Statement-1.
option_texts.B: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is false
option_texts.C: Statement-1 is false, Statement-2 is true
option_texts.D: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true Statement-2 is a correct explanation for Statement-1

questions.question_text: Three distinct points A, B and C are given in the 2 -dimensional coordinates plane such that the ratio of the distance of any one of them from the point $$(1, 0)$$ to the distance from the point $$(-1, 0)$$ is equal to $${1 \over 3}$$. Then the circumcentre of the triangle ABC is at the point :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let A and B denote the statements 
A: $$\cos \alpha  + \cos \beta  + \cos \gamma  = 0$$

B: $$\sin \alpha  + \sin \beta  + \sin \gamma  = 0$$

If $$\cos \left( {\beta  - \gamma } \right) + \cos \left( {\gamma  - \alpha } \right) + \cos \left( {\alpha  - \beta } \right) =  - {3 \over 2},$$  then:

option_texts.A: A is false and B is true
option_texts.B: both A and B are true
option_texts.C: both A and B are false
option_texts.D: A is true and B is false

Output is

questions.subject: Physics

A $$p$$-$$n$$ junction $$(D)$$ shown in the figure can act as a rectifier. An alternating current source $$(V)$$ is connected in the circuit.

The current $$(I)$$ in the resistor $$(R)$$ can be shown by :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
The above is a plot of binding energy per nucleon $${E_b},$$ against the nuclear mass $$M;A,B,C,D,E,F$$ correspond to different nuclei. Consider four reactions : 

$$\eqalign{
  & \left( i \right)\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,A + B \to C + \varepsilon \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\left( {ii} \right)\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,C \to A + B + \varepsilon \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,  \cr 
  & \left( {iii} \right)\,\,\,\,\,\,D + E \to F + \varepsilon \,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\left( {iv} \right)\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,F \to D + E + \varepsilon ,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\,\, \cr} $$ 

where $$\varepsilon $$ is the energy released? In which reactions is $$\varepsilon $$ positive?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The surface of a metal is illuminated with the light of $$400$$ $$nm.$$ The kinetic energy of the ejected photoelectrons was found to be $$1.68$$ $$eV.$$ The work function of the metal is : $$\left( {hc = 1240eV.nm} \right)$$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The transition from the state $$n=4$$  to $$n=3$$ in a hydrogen like atom result in ultra violet radiation. Infrared radiation will be obtained in the transition from :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A transparent solid cylindrical rod has a refractive index of $${2 \over {\sqrt 3 }}.$$ It is surrounded by air. A light ray is incident at the mid-point of one end of the rod as shown in the figure.
 
The incident angle $$\theta $$ for which the light ray grazes along the wall of the rod is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An inductor of inductance $$L=400$$ $$mH$$ and resistors of resistance $${R_1} = 2\Omega $$ and $${R_2} = 2\Omega $$ are connected to a battery of $$emf$$ $$12$$ $$V$$ as shown in the figure. The internal resistance of the battery is negligible. The switch $$S$$ is closed at $$t=0.$$ The potential drop across $$L$$ as a function of time is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In an optics experiment, with the position of the object fixed, a student varies the position of a convex lens and for each position, the screen is adjusted to get a clear image of the object. A graph between the object distance $$u$$ and the image distance $$v,$$ from the lens, is plotted using the same scale for the two axes. A straight line passing through the origin and making an angle of $${45^ \circ }$$  with the $$x$$-axis meets the experimental curve at $$P.$$ The coordinates of $$P$$ will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A mixture of light, consisting of wavelength $$590$$ $$nm$$ and an unknown wavelength, illuminates Young's double slit and gives rise to two overlapping interference patterns on the screen. The central maximum of both lights coincide. Further, it is observed that the third bright fringe of known light coincides with the $$4$$th bright fringe of the unknown light. From this data, the wavelength of the unknown light is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A current loop $$ABCD$$ is held fixed on the plane of the paper as shown in the figure. The arcs $$BC$$ (radius $$= b$$) and $$DA$$ (radius $$=a$$) of the loop are joined by two straight wires $$AB$$ and $$CD$$. A steady current $$I$$ is flowing in the loop. Angle made by $$AB$$ and $$CD$$ at the origin $$O$$ is  $${30^ \circ }.$$ Another straight thin wire steady current $${I_1}$$ flowing out of the plane of the paper is kept at the origin.
 
Due to the presence of the current $${I_1}$$ at the origin:

option_texts.A: The forces on $$AD$$ are  $$BC$$ are zero.
option_texts.C: The magnitude of the net force on the loop is given by $${{{\mu _0}I{I_1}} \over {24ab}}\left( {b - a} \right).$$
option_texts.D: The forces on $$AB$$ and $$DC$$ are zero.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A current loop $$ABCD$$ is held fixed on the plane of the paper as shown in the figure. The arcs $$BC$$ (radius $$= b$$) and $$DA$$ (radius $$=a$$) of the loop are joined by two straight wires $$AB$$ and $$CD$$. A steady current $$I$$ is flowing in the loop. Angle made by $$AB$$ and $$CD$$ at the origin $$O$$ is  $${30^ \circ }.$$ Another straight thin wire steady current $${I_1}$$ flowing out of the plane of the paper is kept at the origin.
 
The magnitude of the magnetic field $$(B)$$ due to the loop $$ABCD$$ at the origin $$(O)$$ is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two points $$P$$ and $$Q$$ are maintained at the potentials of $$10$$ $$V$$ and $$-4$$ $$V$$, respectively. The work done in moving $$100$$ electrons from $$P$$ to $$Q$$ is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Consider a rubber ball freely falling from a height $$h=4.9$$ $$m$$  onto a horizontal elastic plate. Assume that the duration of collision is negligible and the collision with the plate is totally elastic. 


Then the velocity as a function of time and the height as a function of  time will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
(This question contains Statement-1 and Statement-2. Of the four choices given after the statements, choose the one that best describes the two statements.)
Statement-1 : For a charged particle moving from point $$P$$ to point $$Q$$, the net work done by an electrostatic field on the particle is independent of the path connecting point $$P$$ to point $$Q.$$

Statement-2 : The net work done by a conservative force on an object moving along a closed loop is zero.

option_texts.A: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true; Statement-2 is the correct explanation of Statement-1.
option_texts.B: Statement-1 is true, Statement-2 is true; Statement-2 is not  the correct explanation of Statement-1.
option_texts.C: Statement- 1 is false, Statement- 2 is true.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A charge $$Q$$ is placed at each of the opposite corners of a square. A charge $$q$$ is placed at each of the  other two corners. If the net electrical force on $$Q$$ is zero, then $$Q/q$$ equals:

questions.question_text: Let $$P\left( r \right) = {Q \over {\pi {R^4}}}r$$ be the change density distribution for a solid sphere of radius $$R$$ and total charge $$Q$$. For a point $$'p'$$ inside the sphere at distance $${r_1}$$ from the center of the sphere, the magnitude of electric field is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Three sound waves of equal amplitudes have frequencies $$\left( {v - 1} \right),\,v,\,\left( {v + 1} \right).$$ They superpose to give beats. The number of beats produced per second will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If $$x,$$ $$v$$ and $$a$$ denote the displacement, the velocity and the acceleration of a particle executing simple harmonic motion of time period $$T,$$ then, which of the following does not change with time?

questions.question_text:
Two moles of helium gas are taken over the cycle $$ABCD$$, as shown in the $$P$$-$$T$$ diagram.
 
The net work done on the gas in the cycle $$ABCDA$$ is:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Two moles of helium gas are taken over the cycle $$ABCD,$$ as shown in the $$P$$-$$T$$ diagram.
 
The work done on the gas in taking it from $$D$$ to $$A$$ is :

questions.subject: Physics

Two moles of helium gas are taken over the cycle $$ABCD,$$ as shown in the $$P$$-$$T$$ diagram.
 
Assuming the gas to be ideal the work done on the gas in taking it from $$A$$ to $$B$$ is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A long metallic bar is carrying heat from one of its ends to the other end under steady-state. The variation of temperature $$\theta $$ along the length $$x$$ of the bar from its hot end is best described by which of the following figures?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: One $$kg$$ of a diatomic gas is at a pressure of $$8 \times {10^4}\,N/{m^2}.$$ The density of the gas is $$4kg/{m^3}$$. What is the energy of the gas due to its thermal motion ?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Statement - 1: The temperature dependence of resistance is usually given as $$R = {R_0}\left( {1 + \alpha \,\Delta t} \right).$$ The resistance of wire changes from $$100\Omega $$  to $$150\Omega $$ when its temperature is increased from $${27^ \circ }C$$ to $${227^ \circ }C$$. This implies that $$\alpha  = 2.5 \times {10^{ - 3}}/C.$$ 
Statement - 2: $$R = {R_0}\left( {1 + \alpha \,\Delta t} \right)$$ is valid only when the change in the temperature $$\Delta T$$ is small and $$\Delta T = \left( {R - {R_0}} \right) <  < {R_0}.$$

option_texts.A: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true; Statement - 2 is the correct explanation of Statement - 1
option_texts.B: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true; Statement - 2 is not the correct explanation of Statement - 1
option_texts.C: Statement - 1 is false, Statement - 2 is true
option_texts.D: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is false

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two wires are made of the same material and have the same volume. However wire $$1$$ has cross-sectional area $$A$$ and wire $$2$$ has cross-sectional area $$3A.$$ If the length of wire $$1$$ increases by $$\Delta x$$ on applying force $$F,$$ how much force is needed to stretch wire $$2$$ by the same amount?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The height at which the acceleration due to gravity becomes $${g \over 9}$$ (where $$g=$$ the acceleration due to gravity on the surface of the earth) in terms of $$R,$$ the radius of the earth, is:

questions.question_text: A thin uniform rod of length $$l$$ and mass $$m$$ is swinging freely about a horizontal axis passing through its end. Its maximum angular speed is $$\omega $$. Its center of mass rises to a maximum height of:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A particle has an initial velocity $$3\widehat i + 4\widehat j$$ and an acceleration of $$0.4\widehat i + 0.3\widehat j$$. Its speed after 10 s is:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
In an experiment the angles are required to be measured using an instrument, 29 divisions of the
main scale exactly coincide with the 30 divisions of the vernier scale. If the smallest division of the
main scale is half-a degree(=$$0.5^\circ $$), then the least count of the instrument is:
